page.title: 11Fordham Church in 1985
page.content: The church needs between{five and six {thousand}pounds per year in order to keep going. They raise the money by {donations, covenants}and some{fund {raising}events, including the fete. Three thousand pounds of this is for the{quota.}This is sent to the Diocese and is used to help pay rectors' salaries, pensions and church expenses. The rector has two services on a Sunday, one at Fordham and one at Eight Ash Green. This is because he is also rector of Eight Ash Green. The service the rector likes best is the Holy Communion service. He also holds a morning service called Matins and an evening service called Evensong. There are also christenings, weddings and funerals. There are twelve members on the{Parochial Church Council, including two church wardens. Autumn is the busiest time for the rector.
